article.headline: (11) TEXAS 122, SAM HOUSTON ST 71
article.story:
AUSTIN, Texas (Ticker) -- P.J. Tucker is making an immediate 
impact.

The freshman forward made 8-of-9 shots, scored 18 points and
grabbed 11 rebounds in 21 minutes as No. 11 Texas routed Sam
Houston State, 122-71.

Texas (2-0) had six players in double figures in the easy win
but it was the play of Tucker off the bench that continues to
create a stir.

After becoming just the third frosh in school history to post a
double-double in his debut, Tucker was just as good in this one.
He had 13 points in the opening half, when the Longhorns raced
to a 19-point lead midway through the half and took a 67-29 edge
into the break.

Sydmill Harris added 23 points and Brandon Mouton chipped in 20
as Texas improved to 11-2 all-time against their in-state
rivals.

Joe Thompson led the Bearkats with 13 points off the bench.

Sam Houston State (1-1) shot just 6-of-26 from 3-point range,
committed 22 turnovers and was outrebounded, 58-29 in the rout.
